meanings.definition: To rise to an upright position.
meanings.sent1: She struggled to upstand after sitting for a long time.
meanings.sent2: Every morning, he would upstand from his bed ready for the day.
meanings.sent3: The sleepy cat tried to upstand but ended up flopping back down.
meanings.sent4: Like a determined tree, she upstood against the strong wind.
meanings.sent5: The flower upstood proudly towards the sunlight, reaching for its warmth.

meanings.definition: To take a stand in support of something.
meanings.sent1: The community decided to upstand against the unfair treatment.
meanings.sent2: She always upstands for equality and justice.
meanings.sent3: The children upstood against the idea of having vegetables for dinner.
meanings.sent4: In the face of adversity, he upstood for what he believed in.
meanings.sent5: The brave knight upstood against the dragon to protect the village.

meanings.sent1: The mountain climber found a sturdy upstand to hold onto.
meanings.sent2: The building had an architectural design with decorative upstands.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel leaped from upstand to upstand in the trees.
meanings.sent4: The balcony had a beautiful upstand overlooking the city.
meanings.sent5: The bookshelf had an upstand to prevent items from falling off.
